availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

creation.placeName: New York City, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York.
City & County of New York } ss:

Thomas Sadler, of the City, County and State of New York, having been appointed a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky, to reside in the City of New York, being duly sworn, deposes and says, that he will well and faithfully execute and discharge all the duties of a Commissioner of Deeds for said State of Kentucky under and by virtue of the Laws of said State.

Sworn to before me this 9th day of March. 1863.
Anthy L. Robertson
Just Supr Ct. N.Y.

figure.ab:
SUPERIOR COURT
OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK

body.p:
New York
Comr of Deeds
Tho. Sadler
Oath
Filed Mar 13th 1863
